definitions: To deal with or make an effort to deal with (a problem or task).
To confront or address (a person or situation) directly.
In sports, especially football, to stop the advance of (an opponent) by seizing and throwing them to the ground.
To undertake or begin to deal with (a task or problem).
examples: We need to tackle this issue head-on.
She decided to tackle the mountain of paperwork.
He tackled the problem with enthusiasm.
